Leaves: Smooth and sticky, diamond- or egg-shaped, lower ones often coarsely toothed but upper ones smooth edged, to 7 x 4 cm.
Flowers: Yellowish daisy flowerheads only 3-5 mm across, in large clusters.
FruitSeeds: 1-2 mm long, smooth, with disproportionately large parachuting hairs up to 12 mm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Shape of lower leaves, and appearance of the fruiting female plant covered in the ‘fluff’ of the parachuting hairs.
Impacts: Reduces agricultural productivity, suppresses and outcompetes native wetland species. Parachuting hairs can cause allergic reactions.
